summary: This is an email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing scheduling and substantive updates regarding a FOIA case related to Jeffrey Epstein. The key update is that Judge Engelmayer expressed skepticism about the breadth of the government's FOIA withholdings under Exemption 7(A) and will order an in camera review. The judge also directed the AUSA to have Audrey Strauss, the U.S. Attorney, personally reconsider the FOIA response.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of a directive from Judge Engelmayer to personally reconsider the FOIA response in the Epstein case. Her schedule is also discussed for a meeting.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Presided over the oral argument in the Epstein FOIA case. He expressed skepticism about the government's withholdings and will order in camera review and specific disclosures.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the main substantive email summarizing the oral argument before Judge Engelmayer and coordinating the follow-up call.

connections.description: The AUSA is communicating a judicial directive to Strauss and coordinating a meeting involving her.
Judge Engelmayer directed the AUSA to have U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss personally reconsider the FOIA response.
The AUSA appeared before Judge Engelmayer in oral argument and is responsible for communicating the judge's orders.

events.title: Oral Argument in Epstein FOIA Case
events.description: A roughly two-hour oral argument was held before Judge Engelmayer regarding FOIA requests related to Jeffrey Epstein. The judge was skeptical of the government's broad use of Exemption 7(A) to withhold documents.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting on Epstein FOIA
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for 4:00 PM among SDNY personnel to discuss the outcome of the oral argument and next steps in the Epstein FOIA case.

keyFacts: Judge Engelmayer ordered that documents withheld by the government in the Epstein FOIA case under Exemption 7(A) be produced to the court for in camera review.
The judge was specifically skeptical that the withholdings were too broad and intended to interfere with the criminal cases (referencing the 'Tortaglione' and 'Noel' cases).

Judge Engelmayer directed that U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss personally reconsider the FOIA response and evaluate whether to confer with Main Justice, noting the recent change in administration might be relevant.
The court also indicated it would ask the government to specify which withheld documents had been produced to defendants in the 'Noel' criminal case under Rule 16.
